channel.description: Recent content in token on Susie Kim

item.title: Comparing tools for obtaining word token and type
item.description: 1 . Text files 2 . Working with R packages 2.1 . Quanteda 2.2 . Tidytext 3 . Results from Natural Language Processing Tools 3.1 . spacy 3.2 . Stanford CoreNLP 4 . Comparisons 4.1 . Tokens 4.2 . Types When analyzing texts in any context, the most basic linguistic characteristics of the corpus (i.e., texts) to describe are word tokens (i.e., the number of words) and types (i.e., the number of distinct words).
